Problem B: pSort

Problem C: Por Costel and the Match

We have only two different teams, so every marine will be either in marine A or in marine B. We will answer all observations by "YES" unless the observation will make two marines of the same team shoot each other. Make a DSU of size N and keep for every set in the DSU the representative of the set which we are sure it is in the enemy team (initially -1). When given an observation (x, y), the observation is false if x and y are in the same set. Otherwise, we have four sets to take into consideration: x, y, enemy[x], enemy[y]. x and enemy[y] will be in the same set (say S), and y and enemy[x] will be in the same set (say T). Last but not least, update enemy[S] = T and enemy[T] = S.

Java Implementation
